channel.title: Adding a cost to a command
channel.description: Hey, I was wondering if anyone knew how to add a price to a command. For example, I have a command that gears you fully for hybrid pking but I want it to cost around 100m, any one know the code to add?! Thanks in advance!

item.title: Adding a cost to a command
item.dc:creator: @iamlies iamlies
item.description:
@iamlies wrote:

Yeah, i suppose I am lawl, how do i bank the items instead, this is old code from the source i got it from

e”) & c.playerHasItem (995, 100000000)) {

item.title: Adding a cost to a command
item.dc:creator: @iamlies iamlies
item.description:
@iamlies wrote:

Thanks so much man! You’ve really help me out :), do you know how I could bank all the items in my inventory and equipped instead of deleting? im a noob coder

i get this error:

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:921: error: cannot find symbol
playerHasItem (995, 100000000);
^
symbol: method playerHasItem(int,int)
location: class Commands
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
item.source: Adding a cost to a command

item.title: Adding a cost to a command
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

[quote=“iamlies, post:3, topic:431091”]if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“brid”)) {
c.getItems().deleteAllItems();
int itemsToAdd[] = { 4151, 6585, 10551, 20072, 11732, 11726, 15220, 7462,
2440, 2436, 3024};
for (int i = 0; i < itemsToAdd.length; i++) {
c.getItems().addItem(itemsToAdd[i], 1);
}
int[] equip = { 10828, 2414, 18335, 15486, 4712, 6889, -1, 4714, -1,
6922, -1, 6920, 15018};
for (int i = 0; i < equip.length; i++) {
c.playerEquipment[i] = equip[i];
c.playerEquipmentN[i] = 1;
c.getItems().setEquipment(equip[i], 1, i);
}
c.getItems().addItem(555, 1200);
c.getItems().addItem(560, 800);
c.getItems().addItem(565, 400);
c.getItems().addItem(5698, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(391, 13);
c.playerMagicBook = 1;
c.setSidebarInterface(6, 12855);
c.getItems().resetItems(3214);
c.getItems().resetBonus();
c.getItems().getBonus();
c.getItems().writeBonus();
c.updateRequired = true;
c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}[/quote]

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("brid") && playerHasItem(###, ****)) {

change #### to the item id and the **** to the amount you need to do that command.
So if i put

that means the player needs to have 1000 coins to do that command.

that means if the player typed in brid and h

Read full topic
item.source: Adding a cost to a command

item.title: Adding a cost to a command
item.dc:creator: @iamlies iamlies
item.description:
@iamlies wrote:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“brid”)) {
c.getItems().deleteAllItems();
int itemsToAdd[] = { 4151, 6585, 10551, 20072, 11732, 11726, 15220, 7462,
2440, 2436, 3024};
for (int i = 0; i < itemsToAdd.length; i++) {
c.getItems().addItem(itemsToAdd[i], 1);
}
int[] equip = { 10828, 2414, 18335, 15486, 4712, 6889, -1, 4714, -1,
6922, -1, 6920, 15018};
for (int i = 0; i < equip.length; i++) {
c.playerEquipment[i] = equip[i];
c.playerEquipmentN[i] = 1;
c.getItems().setEquipment(equip[i], 1, i);
}
c.getItems().addItem(555, 1200);
c.getItems().addItem(560, 800);
c.getItems().addItem(565, 400);
c.getItems().addItem(5698, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(391, 13);
c.playerMagicBook = 1;
c.setSidebarInterface(6, 12855);
c.getItems().resetItems(3214);
c.getItems().resetBonus();
c.getItems().getBonus();
c.getItems().writeBonus();
c.updateRequired = true;
c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

Read full topic
